properties.address: Ashburton Hall & Park, London CR0 6NN
properties.description: Ashburton Hall, Croydon's Community Hub, aims to create a place for local groups, charities, artists and fitness enthusiasts to meet and enjoy and socialise in this beautiful space. The Better Coffee Corner at Ashburton Hall is located right in the heart of Ashburton Park and is open to all. Starting from Monday 4th December, local residents will be able to keep warm, charge a phone and enjoy a friendly chat over a cuppa with our new Warm Spaces Scheme. Feel free to drop-in during the times below and enjoy the company of your community. We'll also be able to sign post to local leisure and sport activities available at the centre.
properties.title: Ashburton Hall & Park

properties.address: Ashtead Library, Surrey KT21 2BQ
properties.description: A warm space open to all. Includes books for pleasure and learning, free Wi-Fi and computer access. Also available are free hot and cold drinks and activities such as games and puzzles.
properties.title: Ashtead Library

properties.address: Civic Centre, The Horseshoe,, SM7 2BQ
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 7th November 2023** Our music hubs are designed to bring together all members from the local community for an hour of intergeneration fun. This includes singing, arts&crafts and lots of music to kick start conversations.
properties.title: Banstead Music Hub

properties.address: Brio Retirement, Wallington, Surrey SM6 7GD
properties.description: Button House is open Tuesday - Sunday offering soup of the day and a roll for £2 for 55s in the local community.

properties.address: 7 Ruskin Hall, Surrey SM5 3DE
properties.description: We meet in the Ruskin Hall on Thursdays from10am -1pm. Free refreshments, tea, coffee biscuits. Light lunches served at low prices. A friendly welcome is assured.

properties.address: Christ Church Ewell, Cheam Road, Ewell, Surrey KT17 1AD
properties.description: Lonely people welcome or anyone else who would just like to connect with others in their community. Wednesdays 10am - 1pm. "Coffee Drop In" Warm Space - with hot filter coffee, tea, quality biscuits, opportunity to meet others in the community, scrabble, rummikub, other games, puzzles, hot quality home made soup with bread served at 12 noon, weekly notices, short 'thought for the day', toddler toy area, craft table, notices and free thermal items from the council. Free parking for attendees at KT17 1AD
properties.title: Christ Church Ewell

properties.address: Crossways Community Baptist Church, Dorking, Surrey RH4 3HB
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 5th November 2025** A warm and accessible venue offering free hot drinks and food, free energy advice, winter fuel vouchers and warm winter items. There is also the offer of company, arts and crafts, board games and toys for children. The building is fully wheelchair accessible and includes an accessible toilet. *Please note the Warm Welcome Cafe is currently open term time only*
properties.title: Crossways Community Cafe

properties.address: Crown Road Baptist Church, Surrey, Surrey SM1 1RT
properties.description: Come and join our regular Thursday coffee morning. Enjoy a cup of tea, coffee or chocolate with biscuits and cakes too. We welcome carers with their children. Local resident wanting a warm space, a quiet chat or social contact will find a warm and friendly welcome. We are just a two or three minute walk from Sainsbury’s
properties.title: Crown Road Baptist Church (Sutton)

properties.address: Dorking Christian Centre, Dorking, Surrey RH4 1DW

properties.title: Dorking Library

properties.address: Emmanual Centre, South Croydon, Surrey CR2 7AF
properties.description: The 1st floor space is accessible to all via Stairs or list. Tables Chairs Comfy Sofas Very Warm Free Hot drinks/Biscuits/Free light Hot lunch of soup and roll plus fruit
properties.title: Emmanuel Renew Lounge

properties.address: Ewell Hall, Epsom, Surrey KT17 2AY
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 5th November 2024** From November 5th St Mary the Virgin Ewell will be running a Warm Hub and Refugee conversation cafe at Ewell Hall, London Rd. We are the church at the heart of Ewell Village and here to serve all people in our community. Please drop in on Tuesdays between 5:45 and 7:00pm. Free hot food, Wi-Fi, games, puzzles, energy and home advice resources, Wheel chair access, free warm thermal items, coffee, tea, biscuits, sometimes a song, lots of other activities and lots of great conversation. St Mary the Virgin, Ewell, KT17 2AY

properties.address: Farm Road, Esher, Surrey KT10 0HT
properties.description: Open from 3/11/25. Runs every Weds 9.30-12.30 alongside our Advice Cafe which offers free energy advice and other support. Free tea and coffee available during Warm Welcome session. Warm, bright and welcoming, our cafe is open Mon-Thurs 9.30-4.00 (10.00-3.00 in school holidays) serving home made soup, snacks, cakes, cookies and other goodies at affordable prices. We operate a Pay It Forward system and a Community Fridge so food is always available if finances are tight. There is a small enclosed play area for pre-school children, with comfy seating and space to sit, chat, relax or work with wi-fi, books, crafts, puzzles, etc available for all to use.
properties.title: Lower Green Community Centre

properties.address: Morden Leisure Centre, Surrey SM4 5HE
properties.description: A warm welcoming space for everyone, Morden leisure centre located in the heart of Morden overlooking Morden Park. Come and visit Cafe located in the reception area providing a great meeting place to relax with a hot drink.
properties.title: Morden Leisure Centre

properties.address: Oasis Academy Arena, London, London SE25 4QL
properties.description: A space of young people and their families. Part of Oasis Academy Arena.
properties.title: Oasis Community Space

properties.address: Rainbow Leisure Centre, Surrey KT17 1BN
properties.description: We’re opening spaces to local residents this winter to keep warm, charge a phone and enjoy a friendly chat over a cuppa. Feel free to drop-in during the times below and enjoy the company of your community.
properties.title: Rainbow Leisure Centre

properties.address: The Parish Church Of St. Matthew, Croydon, Surrey CR0 5NQ
properties.description: Every Monday from 2.00pm-4.00pm our hall becomes a community space for a variety of hobbies and activities. These are run by the community for the community. Anyone is welcome to share a hobby or skill and anyone is welcome to join a workshop or activity. They are all free. Or you can come and relax and chat, or enjoy the peace in our quiet area. The activities are based around the '5 ways to wellbeing' which promote good mental and emotional health. To connect, give, be active, keep learning and take notice will hopefully contribute towards a preventative approach to mental ill health. All are welcome. Phone: 020 8681 3147 Email: churchadmin@stmatthew.org.uk
properties.title: Renew 121

properties.address: St. Lawrence Church, Morden, Surrey SM4 5QT
properties.description: Starting again Thursday 2nd November 2023. Every Thursday, 1-3pm, we’ll have the heating on – come and get welcomed, get warm, and have a cuppa. Free – Warm – Safe – Welcoming
properties.title: St Lawrence Church Warm Space

properties.address: St. Lukes Church, Surrey RH2 8HY
properties.description: A warm space open to all
properties.title: St Luke's Church, Reigate

properties.address: Croham Road / Croham Park Avenue, South Croydon, Croydon CR2 7HF
properties.description: We are using our lovely Jubilee Room on the third Thursday afternoon of every month . We offer hot and cold refreshments from 3.30 and a home-cooked supper for guests at around 5.30. We chat, listen, play games, read, chill, draw, puzzle, surf and just relax together. Most of our guests have had some challenges in their lives and find our space safe, open and affirming. All volunteers are DBS checked. We welcome people of all ages but currently our guests are all adults. Those under 14 should be accompanied by an adult please. Please call or text ahead if you are coming so we know numbers for catering. We have quiet space as well as board games, etc available.
properties.title: St Paul's United Reformed Church

properties.address: St. Nicholas Church Hall, Surrey, Surrey KT7 0QQ
properties.description: On Tuesday we run a community hub from 9:30am-12pm; This includes a cooked breakfast; a cafe serving barista style coffees, tea, cake; a Foodbank Hub; a CAB advisor; a pre-loved clothes rail; a knit & natter craft table; a Bereavement cafe (in partnership with Princess Alice Hospice). On Thursday morning we have a parent (or carer) and toddler group from 9:30-11:30am (during term time). On Friday morning (10am-12pm) we have the Talbot House Cafe run by students from St. Phillips SEND school in Chessington (during term time).
properties.title: St. Nicholas' Thames Ditton Community Hub

This might include, for example:- warm welcoming place to relax; games and other activities; phone charging points; hot f...: A warm welcoming community cafe open to everyone. On Tuesday mornings the cafe is closed for our Bavby & Toddler Group for ages 0-5 from 9.15am-11.00am. Wednesday - Saturday the cafe is open to all serving barista coffee, hot & cold drinks, homemade cakes and hot and cold lunch options. Board games and books are free to use for children. St Christopher's hospice host a drop in bereavement group in the cafe on Thursday mornings. The cafe hosts a paid for monthly Nest craft workshop. properties.address: St Alban's Church Hall, 1, Whitehorse Lane, Croydon, SE25 6RD, United Kingdom
properties.description:
Come along and joinus  for a 'free' warm meal, in a warm space, with warm company. Everyone is welcome!

FoodCycle hosts a FREE three-course meal all made from food that would go to waste. 

When: Every Saturday at 12:30 pm (Rosary @ 12 noon)

Where: Food Cycle Thornton Heath, St Alban’s Church, Grange Road, 1 Whitehorse Lane, SE25 6RD
properties.title: Food Cycle - Thornton Heath Project

properties.address: Normanton Road, South Croydon, Surrey, CR2 7AF, United Kingdom
properties.description:
Emmanuel Church wants to invite residents in need of a warm space to join their many activities at the church, including:


Selam English classes for women (Tuesday and Thursday morning)


Keep Fit for Older people (Friday morning)

Circuit training (Tuesday evening)

Badminton Club (Wednesday evening)


Bumps and Babies (Thursday afternoon)

Emmanuel toddlers (Wednesday morning)

Saturdads (Saturday morning)


Church service (Sunday morning)

The Rock service (Sunday morning)

Friday Rockz service (Friday evening)

20’s-30’s Pot Luck Cafe (Tuesday, Thursday, Sunday)


Find out more athttps://croydon.simplyconnect.uk/providers/bd4f9660-4d52-11ed-beaf-2dae8c6e01e7/emmanuel-church?
properties.title: Emmanuel Church

properties.address: St. Edward King and Confessor Church, Cleves Crescent, Croydon, Surrey, CR0 0DL, United Kingdom
properties.description:
WARM-SPACE: Soup offered from  12:30 pm - 1:30 pm

                              Singing old-time songs from 3.00 pm till 4.00 pm

All ages are welcome but children must be accompanied by an adult

Day: Thursday

Time: 10 am to 4 pm

Where: St. Edward King and Confessor Church, Cleves Crescent Croydon, CR0 0DL

Contact Information: Father Prem: 07942755011 Lesley Clay: 07495 688660 | prem_rajcsi@yahoo.com

properties.address: 45, Brook Road, Thornton Heath, Surrey, CR7 7RD, United Kingdom
properties.description:
St Andrew's Roman Catholic Church is open as a 'Warm Hub' with plenty of tea and biscuits and also a soup lunch and activities. 


When: Tuesdays from 11 am – 4 pm 

Where: St Andrew's Roman Catholic Church, 45 Brook Rd, Thornton Heath CR7 7RD


For more information contact Danielle, Parish Secretary on  020 8684 3013 or email thorntonheath@rcaos.org.uk

properties.address: South Norwood Library, Lawrence Road, London, Surrey, SE25 5AA, United Kingdom
properties.description:
Residents are welcome to visit their local library to browse books, use the PCs or enjoy the warm welcoming library environment. The venue itself doesn't have a car park and there isn't a nearby public car park, but standard marked parking bays are available on Whitworth Road and Lawrence Road. On-street Blue Badge parking is also available on Whitworth Road.

When: Tuesday and Friday from 10 am to 6 pm

020 7884 5195 | southnorwoodlibrary@croydon.gov.uk

Where: South Norwood Library, Lawrence Road London SE25 5AA United Kingdom

properties.address: Purley United Reformed Church, 906 Brighton Road, Purley, Surrey, CR8 2LN, United Kingdom
properties.description:
A warm welcome awaits you.

Free snacks, hot drinks and activities (board games, puzzles, reading books, etc.) with toast and fruit at lunchtime. Wi-fi and device charging. Wheelchair accessible and toilets for the disabled.


When: Tuesday and Saturday from 10 am to 1.30 pm


Where: Purley United Reformed Church, 906 Brighton Road, Purley, CR8 2LN

Contact Information: caretaking@purleyurc.org.uk

properties.address: Sumner Road, Croydon, Surrey, CR0 3LJ, United Kingdom
properties.description:
Open house for all who wish to come along, Tea and food, sometimes speakers. (WARM-SPACE)

We meet in our church lounge. 


We meet every third Wednesday of the month from 1.30-3.30


For more information contact: normawap@aol.com or 020 8649 7620
